Curing Cancer - Cancer is one of the leading causes of death worldwide. By curing cancer, we can significantly reduce the number of deaths due to this disease. It would not only save lives but also alleviate the suffering of those affected by cancer.

Treating Alzheimer's Disease - Alzheimer's disease is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder that affects memory, thinking, and behavior. By treating Alzheimer's disease, we can improve the quality of life for millions of people who suffer from this condition.

Eradicating Polio - Polio is a highly infectious viral disease that paralyzes its victims. By eradicating polio, we can prevent the spread of this disease and ensure that children around the world have the opportunity to grow up healthy and strong.

Treating HIV/AIDS - HIV/AIDS is a chronic and potentially fatal infection caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). By developing new treatments for HIV/AIDS, we can help people living with this disease manage their symptoms and extend their lifespans.

Preventing Malaria - Malaria is a mosquito-borne disease that kills millions of people each year. By preventing malaria, we can protect vulnerable populations from this deadly disease and reduce the burden on healthcare systems around the world.
